title: Typophile OS X icon
content:
Am I the only one who can't get the Typophile OSX icon to work ? I downloaded it, but I just see some empty folders (running under jaguar)   
Or maybe I didn't dig the forum threads enough...
author: szlobodan

comments.content: Yep. Using safari, but I tried with IExplorer. I'm also using Stuffit X, but the problem really seems to be in the .zip file, since its content isn't was I expected (nice icon to show off with !)

the link :   
 [http://www.typophile.com/downloads/typophile\_icon.zip](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019095803/http:/www.typophile.com/downloads/typophile_icon.zip)   
   
it is the OSX typophile icon which is downloadable to customize folders, etc... on a user's HD.

Well, I tryed it on another machine and it didn't work either. Maybe something is rotten in my typographic kingdom ;)   
Thanks for caring anyway.

Yes, Yves, that is the usual way to customize one's icon. But It still doesn't work for me ! Urgh. Take a look at what I get when I decompress the file.


1.pdf (8.6 k)



2.pdf (9.7 k)
Hmm. I was afraid of that. Curious: are you using Safari?
Which icon? I'm on OS X and using Safari. Tell me what/where and I'll look from here too.

Hold it, maybe this is all a misunderstanding (possibly on my part).   
   
I downloaded and decompressed the file, which appeared to be an   
empty folder which looks like the typophile icon. I selected both my   
"Macintosh HD" and the Typophile folder and pressed cmd-i (Show   
info). Then I clicked the Typophile icon in its info window, pressed   
cmd-c (Copy), clicked my hard drive icon in its info window and   
pressed cmd-v (Paste).   
   
Is this how it's still done? 'cause it looks like it worked on my computer...

You're right. There's nothing Typophilish about that folder.   
Tough noogies... ![:-(](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019095803im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/sad.gif)
